intro: Peplis australis var. timeroyi, commonly known as the Timor peplis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
